abstract: One of the biggest shareholders criticized the company’s deal to sell itself for $2.8 billion to the investor Carl C. Icahn.
snippet: One of the biggest shareholders criticized the company’s deal to sell itself for $2.8 billion to the investor Carl C. Icahn.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT, Feb. 9  One of the biggest shareholders of the Lear Corporation, a manufacturer of automotive seats, criticized the company’s deal on Friday to sell itself for $2.8 billion to the investor Carl C. Icahn.

headline.main: Lear Agrees to Buyout Offer of $2.8 Billion From Icahn
headline.print_headline: Lear Accepts Icahn’s Bid, and Big Shareholder Lodges Protest
